briefTitle: Long-term Open-label Study of Botulinumtoxin Type A to Treat Spasticity of Leg(s) or Leg(s) and Arm in Cerebral Palsy
officialTitle: Open-label, Non-controlled, Multicenter Long-term Study to Investigate the Safety and Efficacy of Xeomin® (Incobotulinumtoxin A, NT 201) for the Treatment of Spasticity of the Lower Limb(s) or of Combined Spasticity of Upper and Lower Limb in Children and Adolescents (Age 2 - 17 Years) With Cerebral Palsy
conditions: Lower Limb and Combined Lower Limb and Upper Limb Spasticity Due to Cerebral Palsy

interventions.name: IncobotulinumtoxinA (16-20 Units per kg body weight)
otherNames: Botulinum toxin type A (150 kiloDalton), free from complexing proteins

arms.label: 16-20 Units per kg body weight incobotulinumtoxinA

summary: The purpose of this study is to determine whether injections of Botulinum toxin type A into muscles of the leg(s) or of leg(s) and one arm are safe in treating children/adolescents (age 2-17 years) long-term with increased muscle tension/uncontrollable muscle stiffness (spasticity) due to cerebral palsy.

primaryOutcome.measure: Occurrence of Treatment Emergent Adverse Events (TEAEs) Overall and Per Injection Cycle
primaryOutcome.timeFrame: From the timepoint of first injection up to end of study visit (Week 50-66)
